sen.j: 善能寺（ぜんのうじ）は、京都市東山区にある真言宗泉涌寺派の寺院。
sen.e: Zenno-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Sennyu-ji School located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
Zenno-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Sennyu-ji School located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
Zenno-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Sennyu-ji School located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 泉涌寺の塔頭のひとつで、本尊は聖観音。
sen.e: It is one of the sub-temples within the precinct of Sennyu-ji Temple and the principal image is Sho Kannon.
It is one of the sub-temples within the precinct of Sennyu-ji Temple and the principal image is Sho Kannon.
It is one of the sub-temples within the precincts of Sennyu-ji Temple and the principal image is Sho Kannon.

sen.j: 洛陽三十三所観音霊場第18番札所である。
sen.e: It is the 18th site on the Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage of 33 Temples in Kyoto City.
It is the 18th site on the Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage of 33 Temples in Kyoto City.
It is the 18th site on the Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage of 33 Temples in Kyoto City.
History
History
History

sen.j: この寺は、一説によれば823年（弘仁14年）に空海が八条通油小路通の地に創建したのに始まるという。
sen.e: According to one theory, Zenno-ji Temple originated with a temple founded at Hachijo-dori Street and Abura-no-koji dori Street by Kukai in the year 823.
According to one theory, Zenno-ji Temple originated with a temple founded at Hachijo-dori Street and Abura-no-koji dori Street by Kukai in the year 823.
According to one theory, Zenno-ji Temple originated with a temple founded at Hachijo-dori Street and Aburanokoji-dori Street by Kukai in the year 823.
sen.cmt: Abura-no-koji dori Street→Aburanokoji-dori Streetとしました。

sen.j: 1551年（天文 (日本)20年）に後奈良天皇の命で現在地に移された。
sen.e: It was later relocated to its current site in 1551 by the order of Emperor Go-Nara.
It was later relocated to its current site in 1551 by the order of Emperor Go-Nara.
It was later relocated to its current site in 1551 by the order of Emperor Gonara.

sen.j: 現在の本堂は1971年（昭和46年）のばんだい号墜落事故の遺族の寄進により、すべての航空殉難者の慰霊と事故の絶無を祈願して建立されたものである。
sen.e: The present main hall was constructed using donations contributed by the victims of the Toa Domestic Airlines Flight 533 crash to pray for all airline crash victims and an end to accidents.
The present main hall was constructed using donations contributed by the victims of the Toa Domestic Airlines Flight 533 crash to pray for all airline crash victims and an end to accidents.
The present main hall was constructed using donations contributed by the victims of the Toa Domestic Airlines Flight 533 crash in 1971 to pray for all airline crash victims and an end to accidents.

sen.j: 洛陽三十三所観音霊場
sen.e: Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage of 33 Temples in Kyoto City
Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage of 33 Temples in Kyoto City
Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage of 33 Temples in Kyoto City

sen.j: 17 三十三間堂 -- 18 善能寺 -- 19 今熊野観音寺
sen.e: 17. Sanjusangen-do Temple; 18. Zenno-ji Temple; 19. Imakumano Kannon-ji Temple
17. Sanjusangen-do Temple; 18. Zenno-ji Temple; 19. Imakumano Kannon-ji Temple
17. Sanjusangen-do Temple; 18. Zenno-ji Temple; 19. Imakumano Kannon-ji Temple

sen.j: 京都府京都市東山区泉涌寺山内町34
sen.e: 34 Sennyuji Yamanouchi-cho, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
34 Sennyuji Yamanouchi-cho, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
34 Sennyuji Yamanouchi-cho, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 京都市営バス泉涌寺道バス停から徒歩約10分
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus to 'Nyusenji-michi' bus stop and walk for ten minutes.
Take the Kyoto City Bus to 'Nyusenji-michi' bus stop and walk for ten minutes.
Take the Kyoto City Bus to 'Sennyuji-michi' bus stop and walk for ten minutes.
